description: Come one, come all! This storytime is designed for children of diverse abilities and considers the sensory needs of ALL kids. Stories will be interactive and encourage children to participate with their voices and body movements. Weighted blankets, lap pads, and small fidget toys will be available. This is a safe and comfortable space for all kids to enjoy an activity in their community, socialize, and learn in whatever way works best for them! We plan to host storytime in the children’s area upstairs, next to the café, but will immediately move it to our main level if any attendee is unable to traverse the stairs. All ages are welcome! If you have questions about this event or would like to suggest additional materials, please email Rachel Schilling at rlblinguist@gmail.com.
name: Sensory-Friendly Storytime

description:
A full sensory experience with 8 wines, cheese, and charcuterie! Enjoy tasting 8 wines served with hors d'oeuvres in a mix & mingle setting, with a briefing on each wine!

We are featuring Organic French Wines for this tasting!
name: Sava's Uncorked: Sparkling Wines

description:
Literati welcomes Bill Ayers to Ann Arbor as part of a national tour to celebrate the release of his latest book, Demand the Impossible!: A Radical Manifesto.

Demand the Impossible! is a manifesto for movement-makers. In an era defined by mass incarceration, endless war, economic crisis, catastrophic environmental destruction, and a political system offering more of the same, radical social transformation has never been more urgent. Demand the Impossible! urges us to imagine a world beyond what this rotten system would have us believe is possible. In critiquing the world around us, insurgent educator and activist Bill Ayers uncovers cracks in the system, raising our sights for radical change, and envisioning strategies for building a movement to create a more humane, balanced, and peaceful world.

"For Bill Ayers, it is the freedom of our collective imagination that links the contemporary world—ensconced as it is in pervasive militarism, racist violence, and environmental devastation—to the flourishing of our planet. This is a manifesto that should be read by everyone who wants to believe that “another world is possible.”—Angela Y. Davis, author of Abolition Democracy and Freedom is a Constant Struggle

"With huge numbers of us recognizing the need for transformative change, this ambitious and exuberant book perfectly matches its historical moment. Ayers fearlessly confronts the intersecting crises of our age—endless war, surging inequality, unchecked white supremacy and perilous planetary warming—while mapping emancipatory new possibilities. From the first page, his courage is contagious."—Naomi Klein, author of This Changes Everything and The Shock Doctrine

"Demand the Impossible is more than a book, more than a manifesto. It is a torch. Bill Ayers’ vision for a humane future is incendiary—fire that incinerates old logics and illuminates new paths. If we do not end the violence of militarism, materialism, caging, dispossession, debt, want, ignorance, and global warming, our very survival is impossible. Read aloud."—Robin D. G. Kelley, author of Freedom Dreams

Bill Ayers is a social justice activist, teacher, Distinguished Professor of Education (retired) at the University of Illinois at Chicago, and author of two memoirs, Fugitive Days and Public Enemy.

Event date: 
Tuesday, January 10, 2017 - 7:00pm
Event address: 
124 E. Washington
Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Demand the Impossible!: A Radical Manifesto Cover Image
name: Bill Ayers

description:
Join us for this self-proclaimed "geek show-and-tell." Makers present their creations! 

We have people interested in a wide scope of topics and endeavors. Programming, robots, machining, welding, artistic creations, metal casting, anything being built or created. Pretty much anything someone is "Making" is welcome at a Go-Tech meeting. 

Also, if you have a problem with your project ask for help and the brain trust of Go-Tech will amaze you with solutions to difficulties you haven't even explored yet.. This is an open group all are welcome and especially young makers are encouraged to bring in a project to show off.

Second Tuesday of each month at 7pm.
name: Go-Tech Meeting (second Tuesday of each month)

description:
COLD-PRESSED JUICE CLEANSES ARE BACK!

... and just in time for the New Year! For the month of January only– get 10% off your juice cleanse and a free yoga class with Bikram Yoga West!

Book your Cleanse now with promo code JUICECLEANSEJANUARY at Store.BaboAnnArbor.com!
name: Babo Juice Cleanses

description: Brad Hedeman, Marketing & Product Selection for Zingerman's Mail Order will discuss how important it is to consider your company's culture in your marketing and branding efforts.
name: Marketing Your Company's Culture with Brad Hedeman, Zingerman's

description:
Help the Jim Toy Community Center raise funds for OUTFest 2017 and enjoy a delicious meal, too! Just mention the Jim Toy Center while placing your order anytime on Thursday, January 12 and Pizza House will donate a portion of what you spend back to the Jim Toy Community Center. 

This will work for delivery and online orders as well.
name: Pizza House Fundraiser for the Jim Toy Community Center

description:
The City of Ann Arbor is preparing plans for the reconstruction of W. Liberty Street between First Street and Main Street. To help residents and businesses learn about the improvements to be made as part of project, staff will be hosting a public meeting on Thursday, Jan. 12, 2017 from 11 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. in the multi-purpose room of the Ann Arbor District Library’s downtown branch located at 343 S. Fifth Ave in Ann Arbor.

If you are unable to attend or have questions, please contact Jennifer Nelson, Project Manager, jnelson@a2gov.org or 734.794.6410 x43672

All persons are encouraged to participate in public meetings. Accommodations, including sign language interpreters, may be arranged by contacting the city clerk’s office at 734.794.6140; via email to cityclerk@a2gov.org; or by written request addressed and mailed or delivered to:

City Clerk’s Office
301 E. Huron St. 
Ann Arbor, MI 48104

Requests made with less than two business days’ notice may not be able to be accommodated.

Please visit the project website for updates:  www.a2gov.org/Liberty
name: West Liberty Street Improvements Project Meeting

description:
Need help getting started with cleansing program? Join our Apothecary department manager, Delphine to learn more and get some motivation.

We will go over how cleansing improves overall health, how to pick the right cleanse, and the supplements needed to accompany a cleanse.

There are many benefits associated with cleansing, potentially including:
Increased energy
Appetite reset
Blood sugar balance
Immune system boost
Candida managment
Longevity and more!

One lucky participant will take home Renew Life Organic Essential Detox on us- maybe it will be you?
name: Cleansing 101 with Delphine
